title: round_teeth
body:
A wide, [[open mouth|open-mouthed]] [[smile]] where the front [[upper teeth only|upper teeth]] are drawn as a single round semicircle.

Often, it is reserved for depictions of youthfulness, playful personality, and innocence, and is very often a recurring physical trait in certain characters (as with [[Mizuno Kaede]] and [[Aoi Sora (pairan)|]]). However, it is common enough that it might show up without any qualifiers.

Differs from [[buck teeth]] in that buck teeth describes only the two upper front teeth, or a something that resembles just those two front teeth, while round teeth describes the entire row of front upper teeth.

h4. Examples

* !post #2091083
* !post #3775180

h4. See also

* [[teeth]]
* [[grin]]
* [[buck teeth]]

body:

For Danbooru, the emphasis is usually on physical abuse. To qualify, one person must have caused [[injury]] to another, who has become distressed or [[scared|frightened]] as a result.

title: scamp_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the USS [i]Scamp[/i], hull number SS-277, sixty-sixth of seventy-seven Gato-class submarines of the United States Navy.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] with [[side ponytail]], [[black ribbon|black]] [[hair ribbon]] and [[star hair ornament]] and [[grey eyes]]. She wear a [[aqua headwear|aqua]] [[garrison cap]], [[black one-piece swimsuit|black]] [[highleg one-piece swimsuit|highleg]] [[competition swimsuit]], [[white gloves]], torn [[white shorts|white]] [[short shorts]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[rudder footwear]].

Scamp's personality is somewhat synonymous with what her name denotes: Impish and a little sexual. No thanks to her history, however, she is averse to kaiboukan, especially [[Kaiboukan No. 4 (kancolle)|]].

She is the first ever American and Allied submarine in the game as well as the first foreign submarine who never became part of the IJN. As with all American submarines during WWII, she is named after a marine creature, in her case "a species of grouper fish":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scamp_grouper].

She was illustrated by [[Shizuma Yoshinori]].

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: USS Scamp (SS-277)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Scamp_(SS-277)]
other_names: スキャンプ(艦隊これくしょん)

title: corset
body:
A form-fitting garment, worn around the waist and fastened with laces.

True corsets provide back support with sturdy columns of steel or (historically) whalebone and may be cinched to compress the abdomen for a [[curvy]] figure. Corsets were traditionally considered underwear, but in modern times are sometimes worn above the clothing, particularly in fetish fashion. Many such outerwear corsets have flimsy or no boning and thus are not rigid enough to support or reshape the body.

Corsets are usually an [[underbust]] garment, covering only the stomach and waist, but overbust designs for breast support also exist.

Not to be confused with the similar-looking [[bodice]], which reaches up to or over the breasts and often has sleeves or arm holes.

h4. Examples

* !post #5747197

title: zettai_ryouiki
body:
Zettai ryouiki (lit. "absolute territory") is the area of bare [[thighs]] seen between a [[skirt]] or [[short dress]] and [[thighhighs]]. The skirt should not be [[skirt lift|lifted up]] or out of place; the thighs should be exposed naturally, by the skirt being too short to cover the tops of the thighhighs. Example characters include [[Tohsaka Rin]], [[Momose Kurumi]] and [[Mayura]]. 

The term itself originates from [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]], although it had none of the current connotations in the anime. The modern usage of zettai ryouiki originates from the creator of a desktop mascot application when he used the term on his blog in reference to [[Mayura]]. 

Do not use this tag for [[single thighhigh]], [[shorts]], or when the [[panties]], [[underwear]], or genitalia are visible beneath the skirt. [[Thigh boots]] may however still apply.

title: little_boy_(bomb)
body:
A uranium-infused [[nuclear weapon|atomic bomb]] developed by the United States as a part of the Manhattan Project. It was used during the [[atomic bombings of hiroshima and nagasaki|Atomic Bombing of Hiroshima]] on 6 August, 1945, destroying the city in the process. Little Boy is the first nuclear weapon to ever be used in warfare.

Little Boy can be distinguished from its relative [[Fat Man (bomb)|]] by the more cylindrical shape of the bomb casing, as opposed to the more round shape of Fat Man's.

h4. See also
* [[Fat Man (bomb)]]

title: hashima_island
body: A small island located off the coast of [[Nagasaki]], Japan. It is commonly known as "Gunkanjima" (battleship island) due to its usage as a fortification and forced labor camp during World War II.

title: nagasaki
body:
A mountainous coastal city in southern island of Kyushu, [[Japan]], being the capital of the namesake prefecture. The city is a historical trading hub during the 16th century and being one of the earliest hubs of [[Christianity]] in the country.

It was the second city attacked during the [[Atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki]] that ended [[World War II]]. The bombing ocurred in August 9, 1945. The [[B-29 superfortress]] [[bomber]] [i]Bockscar[/i] dropped the atomic bomb "[[Fat Man (bomb)|]]", a 5 short ton Plutonium device with a blast yield of 21 kilotons, in the early morning of that day.

h4.See also
* [[Hashima island]] - aka "Gunkanjima/Battleship island"
* [[Hiroshima]]

title: hiroshima
body:
The main city of Hiroshima perfecture, [[Japan]]. Historically a major port and maritime hub of the country.

Widely remembered for [[atomic_bombings_of_hiroshima_and_nagasaki|being the target of the first ever nuclear weapon attack]] in August 6, 1945. The [[B-29 superfortress]] [[bomber]] [i]Enola Gay[/i] dropped the [[nuclear weapon|atomic bomb]] "[[Little Boy (bomb)|]]", a nearly 1 short ton (9,700 pounds) Uranium device with a blast yield of 15 kilotons, in the early morning of that day.

h4. See also

* [[Hiroshimaben]]
* [[Hiroshima Peace Memorial]]
* [[Nagasaki]]

Consistent with other hybrid transformations, her teeth are always visible and are notably sharp and angular. Bomb fuses cover her arms like sleeves while also making up a portion of her apron along with sticks of dynamite.

Use tag when [[Reze (chainsaw man)|]] is in her Bomb Devil Hybrid form. Do [b]NOT[/b] tag [[nuclear weapon]] on posts featuring Bomb Devil simply because she has a nuke-like head, unless there's an actual nukes in the image.

title: school_bag
body:
A catchall tag for school [[bag]]s used by Japanese students. There are two major styles: the traditional style, which looks like a [[briefcase]], and the modern style, which looks like a small blue [[shoulder bag]].

The traditional style, used by middle and high school students, looks like a [[briefcase]] with a rigid flat front and back, and a single large flap that goes over the top with a handle on the top. It may also have a shoulder strap, but this is rarely depicted. Additionally, this style of bag can also have a strap fastened on the back and can be worn like a [[backpack]].

The modern style looks like a small blue sports bag or duffel bag, with a zipper on the top and a strap on each side. The straps are typically big enough to be worn over the shoulder like a [[shoulder bag]], or sometimes on the back like a [[backpack]].

[[Randoseru]] ([[backpack]]s used by elementary school students) should not be tagged [[school bag]].

h4. Examples

* !post #5230194: Modern style
* !post #2097068: Traditional style

h4. See also

* [[bag charm]]

* [[satchel]]
* [[school briefcase]]
* [[shoulder bag]]

title: survivor_guilt
body:
A type of [[PTSD]] found in person who have survived a life-threatening situation. Individuals who believe it is unfair that they survived when others died and/or believe they did not do enough to save the lives of others may come to experience survivor guilt after trauma or a catastrophic event.

Symptoms of survivor guilt typically include nightmares, difficulty sleeping, flashbacks to the traumatic event, loss of motivation, irritability, a sense of numbness, and thoughts about the meaning of life.

title: mxy-7_ohka
body:
The [b]Yokosuka MXY-7 [i]Ohka ([[cherry_blossoms|Cherry Blossom]])[/i][/b] was a rocket-powered, single-pilot, suicide [[rocket]] flying bomb employed by the [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] during late [[World War II]]. It was flown by [[kamikaze pilot]]s.

Relatively simple to manufacture, and requiring only minimally-trained operators, this "rocket with a cockpit" was extremely hard to shoot down due to its very high speed. Though due to its limited range, the Ohka was usually carried by the slow and large [[G4M]] bombers, which severely limited its effectiveness, as many G4Ms were shot down before being able to deliver the vehicle.

American soldiers nicknamed this aircraft the [i]"Baka"[/i] (literally "idiot" in Japanese).

h4. See also
* [[Kaiten (weapon)]]
* [[The Cockpit: Sonic Boom Squadron]]

title: shenyang_j-31
body:
The [b]Shenyang J-31[/b], rumored to be nicknamed "Gyrfalcon" (鹘鹰), or [i]Falcon Eagle[/i] by some military enthusiasts, is a twin-engine, mid-size fifth-generation fighter [[jet]]  currently under development by [i]Shenyang Aircraft Corporation[/i] for the [[People's Liberation Army Air Force]]. 

The fighter has also been referred to as [b]F-60[/b] (Official Chinese military code name of the export variant) or [b]J-21 Snowy Owl[/b] (雪鸮) in some International media reports.

It is very similar to the American [[F-35 Lightning II]], but is equipped with two engines instead of one and lacks any [[VTOL]] capacity.

title: battle_of_stalingrad
body:
[b]The Battle of Stalingrad[/b] was a major [[battle]] on the Eastern Front of [[World War II]] where [[Nazi]] [[Germany]] and its allies unsuccessfully fought the [[Soviet Union]] for control of the city of Stalingrad (later renamed Volgograd) in Southern [[Russia]]. 

The battle was marked by fierce close-quarters combat and direct assaults on civilians in air raids, with the battle epitomizing urban warfare. It was the deadliest battle of the Second World War in terms of military casualties, with both sides suffering enormous casualties of over 2 million in total. It was also one of, if not, the deadliest battle in history of warfare, with the Siege of Leningrad (also during WWII) being another contender.

Today, the Battle of Stalingrad is universally regarded as the turning point in the European theatre of war, as it forced the Oberkommando der [[Wehrmacht]] (German High Command) to withdraw considerable military forces from other areas in occupied Europe to replace German losses on the Eastern Front, ending with the rout of the six field armies of Army Group B, including the destruction of Nazi Germany's 6th Army (more than a million men) and an entire corps of its 4th Panzer Army. Out of the nearly 91,000 German prisoners captured in Stalingrad, only about 5,000 were returned alive years later in 1955.

This victory, along with the latter [[Battle of Kursk]], energized the [[soviet_army|Red Army]] and shifted the balance of power in the favour of the Soviets for the rest of the war.

h4. See also

* [[Enemy At The Gates]]

* [[Vasily Zaytsev]]
other_names: スターリングラード攻防戦

title: battle_of_kursk
body:
[b]The Battle of Kursk[/b] was a major [[World War II]] Eastern Front large-scale battle between the forces of [[Nazi]] [[Germany]] and the [[Soviet]] Union in the area around the city of "Kursk":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kursk in southwestern [[Russia]] during the late summer of 1943.

The operation ultimately became the largest [[tank]] [[battle]], as well as the largest battle in history of warfare. The Soviet ultimately became victorious, and managed to halt the German advance, eventually gained momentum for subsequent the counter-offensive.

It is considered by some historians to be the turning point of the European theatre of war instead of the [[Battle of Stalingrad]] several months earlier.

title: body_markings
body:
Permanent markings which can be seen on the skin of characters who have human anatomy but are typically either mutated, partially human, or a non-human.

Body markings on humans are also known as a [[birthmark]]. Unlike [[tattoo]], these typically look like straight lines, random shapes and patterns, and markings found on animals.

* [[tattoo]]

title: photo_background
body:
When a real-world [[photo (medium)|]] is used as the background for a drawing.

If the photo was altered (such as being redrawn or filtered) to the point that the photo is indistinct from the rest of the image, then do not apply this tag.

If the photo is used as a reference for character's posture, then the tag [[photo-referenced]] is applicable.

h4. See also

title: tank_man
body:
An infamous photograph showing an unidentified man blocking four [[Type 59 (tank)|]] tanks on June 5, 1989, the day after the [[China|Chinese communist government]] had suppressed the [[Tiananmen Square]] protests of 1989 by force.

The uncropped image shows that a lot more tanks were driving in his path, while the video version shows the man intentionally walked in front of the tank column and around it, seemingly out of defiance. The final fate of the man himself, however, is unknown.

h4. Examples

* !asset #21932813

h4. See also

* [[Tiananmen Square]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Tank Man":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tank_Man]
* "Wikipedia: 1989 Tiananmen Square protests":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1989_Tiananmen_Square_protests]

title: blanka
body:
[b]Blanka (ブランカ)[/b] is a character from [[Capcom]]'s [[Street Fighter]] fighting game series.

Blanka is a feral man from [[Brazil]] who is estrangled from his mother at his youth due to a plane crash over the Amazon forest, later revealed to be caused by Shadaloo to assassinate a politician on board. Being the sole survivor, he begin to adapt with his new home and starting to behave and mutate like an animal, notably having his skin [[green skin|turned green]] and gained an ability to launch [[electricity]] at his enemy. After he was accidentally bought back to a civilization by a poacher truck, he decided to enter the World Warrior tournament to find his mother, and later to learn more about civilization.

h4. See also
* [[Blanka-chan]]

title: zangief
body:
[b]Zangief[/b] is a video game character created by [[Capcom]]. He is part of the [[Street Fighter]] series of fighting games, first starring in [[Street Fighter II (series)|]].

Zangief is a Soviet/Russian wrestler nicknamed the "Red Cyclone" who is notable for his bombastic patriotism and obsession with muscle gain. He is [[muscular male|highly muscular]], with [[brown hair|brown]] [[mohawk]] and thick [[chest hair]], with numerous [[scar]] across his body. His wrestling attire consists of a simple red wrestling pants.

His signature fighting style is close-up and [[wrestler]] based, with devastating throws and powerful base moves. This makes him tough up close, though often has trouble with foes with projectiles. Zangief's fighting style would later be known in the fighting game community as "grappler", and he is considered the very first grappler in the fighting game history.

title: nobi_nobita
body:
The deuteragonist of [i][[Doraemon]][/i].

A lazy boy who will put anything he's not interested on hold until it's too late, which resulted into his family's doomed life in the future. Thus, his great grandson sent [[Doraemon (character)|Doraemon]] back to the past to help him to become a responsible man. He usually wears thick rounded [[glasses]], a [[yellow shirt|yellow]] [[polo shirt]], and [[blue pants|blue]] [[shorts]].

Despite his seemingly terrible responsibility and intelligence (as seen by a running gag about him almost always getting a score of 0 on his monthly exams), he can turn into a very dependable person when someone needs help. He's also notable for his amazing sharpshooting skill.

title: burning_at_the_stake
body:
An [[execution]] method involving [[burning]] the condemned alive. It has a long history as a form of capital punishment, and many societies have employed it for criminal activities such as treason, heresy and witchcraft.

The best-known execution of this type is burning at the stake, where the condemned is bound to a large wooden stake and a fire lit beneath them.

Perhaps the most infamous case of this execution method is when it was used to kill Jeanne d'Arc/[[Joan of Arc]].

The scene involves [[Ikari Shinji]] visiting an unconscious [[Souryuu Asuka Langley]] inside a [[hospital]]. After sitting next to her [[hospital bed]] for awhile, Shinji began to masturbate and ejaculate to relieve his stress while fantasizing about her. After looking at his own [[cum]] [[cum on hands|in his left hand]], Shinji realized what he had done and suffered a mental breakdown.

Commonly associated with the quote "I'm so fucked up" from the English dub.

title: yabuki_joe
body:
[b]Yabuki Joe[/b] is the titular protagonist from [[Ashita no Joe]].

Born in poverty, Joe was an impulsive criminal who committed various petty crimes to survive and help others, which eventually led him to being sent into prison. There, he met [[Rikiishi Tooru]], who challenges him to a [[boxing]] match. Joe feels motivated by this moment and has since decided to delicate his  life to become a world boxing champion.

h4. See also
* [[Yabuki Joe in a chair (meme)]]

title: executioner
body:
A person who was employed to performing an [[execution]].

They are stereotypically depicted wearing a [[hood]] covering their entire face and uses [[axe]] as their weapon of choice.

h4. See also
* [[Executioner's sword]]

title: executioner's_sword
body:
An [[executioner]]'s sword is a [[sword]] whose blade is almost completely rectangular--the end does not curve to a tip or form a point, but simply ends rather suddenly, as shown "here":http://getasword.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2012/06/executioner-sword.jpg. Such blades were usually used for ceremonial purposes or [[execution]]s (hence the name).

Swords like these are typically western in design, and should not be confused with weapons like the "khanda":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Khanda_%28sword%29, a sword from India that [i]was[/i] actually meant to be used in battle.

Despite the historically ceremonial/special-use nature of an executioner's sword, this has not stopped them from being occasionally portrayed as legitimate weapons in media and fanart.

h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Executioner%27s_sword]
other_names: エグゼキューショナーズソード
エクセキューショナーズソード

title: execution
body:
A legal or otherwise enforced method of killing someone, usually as punishment for a crime. 

Typically the condemned is helplessly [[tied up (nonsexual)|bound]] so that he/she cannot escape. The execution is performed by an [[executioner]] using various methods.

The actual execution need not have been carried out according to the image, so long as the subject will die if the situation persists and no outside forces intervene. In this case the image should also have the [[peril]] tag. Alternatively, if the execution has been carried out, the image should include [[death]] and, if the scene is bloody and/or gory, [[guro]] as well.

Preferably, this tag should be used when the situation depicted is that of a currently or previously used form of legal execution, including but not limited to:

* [[burning at the stake]]
* [[crucifixion]]
* [[decapitation]]
* [[electric chair]]
* [[firing squad]]
* [[gas chamber]]
* [[guillotine]]
* [[hanged]]
* lethal [[injection]]

title: double_suicide
body: Shinju refers to any [[suicide]] of two or more individuals who are "bound by love". There was a belief stemming from Edo teachings that [[couple|lovers]] who comitted double suicide would be united in the afterlife. The word is formed from 心 (heart/mind) and 中 (center/inside). As such, its literal definition could be the "oneness of hearts".

title: ken_masters
body:
[b]Ken Masters[/b] is a video game character created by [[Capcom]]. He is one of the main characters from the [[Street Fighter]] series of fighting games alongside [[Ryu (street fighter)|]]. 

Ken was initially created as a [[palette swap]] for [[player 2]] in the first Street Fighter title and thus used an identical moveset to that of Ryu's in early installments, though Capcom later on decided to make the two distinct by making Ken being more specialized on [[Shouryuuken]] in parallel with Ryu's [[Hadouken]].

Ken has a wife, [[Eliza Masters|Eliza]] and a son, [[Mel Masters|Mel]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #234930: [[Street Fighter II (series)|]]
* !post #464239: [[Street Fighter Zero (series)|]]
* !post #1278523: [[Street Fighter III (series)|]]
* !post #309883: [[Street Fighter IV (series)|]]
* !post #2064059: [[Street Fighter V]]
* !post #6222101: [[Street Fighter 6]]


h4. Known moves

* [[Hadouken]]

* [[Shouryuuken]]
** Shouryuu Reppa
** Shinryuuken

* [[Tatsumaki Senpuukyaku]]
** Shippuu Jinraikyaku
** Guren Senpuukyaku

h4. Alternate Forms

* [[Violent Ken]] ([[SvC Chaos]] and [[Street Fighter II (series)|Ultra Street Fighter II: The Final Challengers]])
other_names: ケン(ストリートファイター)

title: ryu_(street_fighter)
body:
[i]You must defeat Sheng Long to stand a chance.[/i]
--Ryu, American version of [[Street Fighter II (series)|Street Fighter II]]
[tn]Mistranslation of the win quote, 昇龍拳を破らぬ限り、お前に勝ち目はない! ([i]lit.[/i] "If you cannot overcome the Shouryuuken, you don't stand a chance!) 
[/tn]

[b]Ryu[/b] is the main character and protagonist of the [[Street Fighter]] series. Ryu has made an appearance in every Street Fighter game, as well as in every crossover game with Capcom characters in it. Ryu has become a very famous character in the fighting genre, and is the star of the original Street Fighter.

As a very young child, Ryu was orphaned and left with no memories about his parents, and whether they were still alive. He was found and adopted by a man named [[Gouken]] who raised Ryu in his secluded dojo and trained Ryu in the ways of his martial arts. Shortly afterwards, Gouken would later train his best friend's spoiled son, [[Ken Masters]]. Ken served not only as a sparring partner, but also gave Ryu a friend in the form of a boy his own age. Ryu looked up to Gouken as a father figure, and regards Ken as his best friend and surrogate brother, a relationship which remains to this day. When Ryu was 23 years old, Gouken believed that Ryu was ready to travel the world in order to test and hone his martial skills against the best fighters from around the world. With this, Ryu left Gouken's dojo, and headed to fight in the World Warrior tournament.

h4. Appearance

* !post #234921: [[Street Fighter II (series)|]]
* !post #7532479: [[Street Fighter Zero (series)|]]
* !post #1278526: [[Street Fighter III (series)|]]
* !post #309889: [[Street Fighter IV (series)|]]
* !post #2037003: [[Street Fighter V]]
* !post #6360628: [[Street Fighter 6]]


h4. Known moves

* [[Hadouken]] (波動拳)
** Shakunetsu Hadouken (灼熱波動拳)
** Shinkuu Hadouken (真空波動拳)
** Denjin Hadouken (電刃波動拳)
** Metsu Hadouken (滅波動拳)

* [[Shouryuuken]] (昇龍拳)
** Shin Shouryuuken (真・昇龍拳)
** Metsu Shouryuuken (滅・昇龍拳)

* [[Tatsumaki Senpuukyaku]] (竜巻旋風脚)
** Shinkuu Tatsumaki Senpuukyaku (真空竜巻旋風脚)

h4. Alternate forms

* [[Evil Ryu]]
* [[Kagenarumono]]

body:
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. Former president of the Abydos High School Student Council. Her full name is Kuchinashi Yume.

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[aqua hair]] with [[swept bangs]] and [[large breasts]]. She wears an Abydos High School uniform with no jacket and a [[chest harness]], quite similar to the uniform Hoshino wears as a third-year student. Her [[halo]] is shaped like the Abydos logo.

title: king_crimson_(stand)
body:
[[Stand (jojo)|]] power of [[Diavolo]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. Manifests as a sneering, usually red, humanoid with a smaller face named Epitaph on its forehead. When used by [[Vinegar Doppio]], the same small face manifests on his forehead instead.

Possesses the ability to predict time up to ten seconds in the future. Diavolo views the interim like "animation frames" superimposed on each other, and is able to remove sections of time as if he were deleting these "frames". To anyone but Diavolo, it appears as if time skipped forward by the amount King Crimson removed.

Namesake is the English rock band [[King Crimson]].

body:

They enjoy working out and want to be strong in order to defy the stereotypes of their appearance.

The character was designed by [[Jeon Jungkook (bts)|]].

title: last_life_smp
body:
Second season of [[Traffic Life Series]]. It ran from September 21 to November 21, 2021.

Unlike the first season, players now recieve a randomized life count. On their final life, they must cut ties with all other players and become hostile. Players are also able to give up a life for another person, or reveal their life count to someone.

This season introduces three new players, being [[PearlescentMoon]], [[mumbo jumbo (youtuber)|Mumbo Jumbo]], and [[LDShadowLady]].

body: The title character of [[Hello Kitty]], whose full name is Kitty White. She lives in England and is five apples tall.

title: hello_kitty
body:
Hello Kitty is a friendly white kitty with the head larger than her body, small button eyes and nose, but [[no mouth]]. She is said to be five apples tall and the weight of three apples.

She was created by Yuko Shimizu and developed by Sanrio into global advertising phenomenon worth billions of dollars. Hello Kitty is a staple of the [i]kawaii[/i] segment of Japanese pop culture and is marketed to all ages.

For information on Hello Kitty herself, see [[Hello Kitty (character)]].

h4. See also

title: nisemonogatari
body:
Nisemonogatari is a series of light novels by Nisioisin, with drawings by [[Vofan]]. It is the sequel to [[Bakemonogatari]]. It was made into an anime by [[Shaft (company)|]] and released on January 8, 2012.

The story follows the two sisters of [[Araragi Koyomi]], [[Araragi Karen]] and [[Araragi Tsukihi]], as they try to prevent the same oddity that cursed [[Senjougahara Hitagi]] from spreading further chaos.

h4. Characters

title: ryan_gosling
body:
Ryan Thomas Gosling (born November 12, 1980) is a Canadian actor. Prominent in both independent film and major studio features of varying genres.

h4. Notable Roles

* [[driver_(drive)|The Driver]] in [[Drive (movie)|Drive]]
* [[Sebastian Wilder]] in [[La La Land]]
* [[k (blade runner 2049)|Agent K]] in [[Blade Runner 2049]]
* [[Ken (Barbie)|Ken]] in [[Barbie (live action)|Barbie]]

h4. See also

* [[Goslingposting (meme)]]

title: cuahchiqueh
body: Cuachicqueh, or "shorn ones" were the elite troops of the Aztecs - Over six captives and dozens of other heroic deeds were required for this rank.

title: grass_wonder_(racehorse)
body:
Real life Japanese racehorse. As one of the "Golden Generation", the horse went on to win three grand prix races in a row ('98 Arima, '99 Takarazuka, and '99 Arima). After retiring due to a fractured leg, the horse became a successful sire, siring Screen Hero and Earnestly.

h4. See also

* [[Grass Wonder (Umamusume)]] - The horse's [[Umamusume]] counterpart
* [[El Condor Pasa (racehorse)|]] - Rival
* [[Special Week (racehorse)|]] - Rival
* [[Jack d'Or (racehorse)|]] - Grandson

title: t.m._opera_o_(racehorse)
body:
Japanese race [[horse]]. Nicknamed "[b]The Overlord of The End of the Century[/b] ([b]世紀末覇王[/b])" by fans, he is famous for winning all 8 races he ran in in the year 2000. This has made him the all-time leading money-earner in the history of Japanese race horses, with over 1.8 billion yen to his name and only 2 other horses (Almond Eye and Kitasan Black has since surpassed him in the 2010s).

h4. See also

* [[T.M. Opera O (Umamusume)|]] - [[Umamusume]] character based on this horse
* [[Wada Ryuji]] - T.M. Opera O's jockey

title: seofon_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
[[Granblue Fantasy]] character and the leader of the Eternals. His name in Japanese is "Siete", which is Spanish for "Seven".

The seemingly carefree leader of the Eternals, seeking to make the world's wrongs right. He's also incredibly fond of swords, hence he wields the Seven Star Sword. While he seems totally unreliable, his claim of being the strongest of the Eternals is no idle boast.

Voiced by [[Suwabe Jun'ichi]].

h4. Appearance

title: seofon_(eternal's_summer_vacation)_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
[[seofon (granblue_fantasy)|Seofon]] in his summer outfit.

This outfit is one in which the Star Sword Sovereign, [[Seofon (granblue_fantasy)|]], can truly enjoy the hot summer. It has been minimized to cover only the necessary area with unshakeable conviction. [[Seofon (granblue_fantasy)|]] states that his triangular apparel is formal wear for the dead of summer. Whether or not he's joking is anyone's guess.

title: threo_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
[[Granblue Fantasy]] character and one of the Eternals. Her name in Japanese is "Saraasa" or "thalaatha/ثلاثة", which is Arabic for "three".

Wielder of the Three Tiger Axe, a fierce warrior who understands the laws of nature which is her creed. Born and raised away from human civilization, Threo relies mostly on her natural instincts and senses whether in and out of combat. This trait and her mentality and desire to become stronger to "reach the top of the food chain" even caused her peers to compare her to a wild beast.

Voiced by [[Takayama Minami]].

title: tien_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
Character from [[Granblue Fantasy]] and one of the Eternals. Her name in Japanese is "Esser", which is Hebrew for "ten".

She leads Stardust Town with her twin brother [[Feower (granblue fantasy)|]]. Determined to find a way to end the cycle of hatred, she stepped forward to take sole responsibility for all the fighting in the reaches. She cherishes her family, and will fight hard to protect them.

title: niyon_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
[[Granblue Fantasy]] character and one of the Eternals. Niyon's name in Japanese is "Nio", which is Swedish for "nine".

Wielder of the Nine Realm Harp, she is a musician who can hear the music of all living things, spinning them into an ethereal melody. Her songs are said to be capable of bringing an entire army to their knees, but she simply wishes to find those with beautiful melodies.

title: niyon_(lejonskrik)_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
[[Niyon (granblue fantasy)|]] in her halloween costume, the name means "Lion Scream" in Swedish.

All the pitiful prey in the world know to cower before the mighty lion, whose mane gleams gold and whose claws rip without mercy. Full of pride, it roars to announce its place at the top of the food chain. One brave magical harpist attunes herself to the melody of the mighty lion, readying herself to attend a banquet of illusions.

h4. Appearance

* !post #4854848

title: niyon_(violet_anonymity)_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
An alternate costume of [[Niyon (granblue fantasy)|]] in [[Granblue Fantasy]]. Appeared in Together in Song (Story Event).

A modest, violet themed outfit that [[Niyon (granblue fantasy)|Niyon]] wears when she wishes to travel incognito and conceal the fact that she's a member of the Eternals. Pulling the hat low over her eyes makes her feel at ease.

h4. Appearance

* !post #4854856

title: tweyen_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
[[Granblue Fantasy]] character and one of the Eternals.

Her name in Japanese is "ソーン", which has earned a number of different romanizations in the English speaking community, including Song, Sorn, and Thorn. In particular, "Song" means "two" in Thai and Lao, fitting with the number based naming theme of the rest of the Eternals.

The wielder of the Two Crown Bow. [[Tweyen_(granblue_fantasy)|]] was born with incredible eyesight, being able to spot objects unassisted from miles away. This, combined with her ability to fire magical arrows, has made her a legendary archer. However, she worries her that her strength may have only brought her loneliness, especially after it sparked an incident that separated her from her dearest friend...

She is close friends with [[Silva_(granblue_fantasy)|]].

Voiced by [[Minaguchi Yuuko]].

h4. Appearance

title: haaselia
body:
One of the members of the Evokers. An [[Harvin]] woman from [[Granblue Fantasy]]. The enlightened High Priestess, pact bearer to the Arcarum primal beast [[The Moon (granblue_fantasy)|]].

The resourceful and ingenious High Priestess wears an elegant smile, shrouding the clever deceit she keeps inside. She reached the breaking point of her pace when tragedy struck, transforming her festering enmity into a desire for revenge. Her heart now stained black, Haaselia is prepared to do whatever it takes to accomplish her goal even if it means deceiving those close to her.

h4. External links

* "Granblue Fantasy Wiki: Hasselia":https://gbf.wiki/Haaselia

title: lobelia_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
[[Granblue Fantasy]] character and one of the members of the Evokers. The shrewd Magician, pact bearer to the Arcarum primal beast [[The Tower (granblue fantasy)|]]. 

In his youngest days this magician found happiness in the sound of destruction. A natural genius turned natural disaster, he used his power to lay low other people and lands, trapping the sounds that result. In the aftermath, he discovers true happiness. Born to destruction and living within it, the magician is satisfied by the happy sound of his own destruction, which rings out with a tune of eternal torment.

h4. External links

* "Granblue Fantasy Wiki: Lobelia":https://gbf.wiki/Lobelia

title: yuigaoka_music_program_school_uniform
body:
The [[school uniform]] worn by the students attending the special music program at the Yuigaoka Girls' High School in [[Love Live! Superstar!!]].

The [[winter uniform|winter]] version is very similar to the regular uniform and consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]] worn under a [[short dress|short]] [[grey dress|grey]] [[pinafore dress]], with the main difference from the regular uniform being that it has a [[red bowtie]] instead of a neck ribbon and a [[double-breasted]] [[white jacket]] instead of the blue blazer. 

The [[summer uniform|summer]] version is quite different and is a more traditional [[serafuku|]] with a [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[sailor shirt]], a [[grey sailor collar]] and a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[grey skirt|grey]] [[miniskirt]].

h4. Examples
* !post #5708564: Winter uniform
* !post #4847638: Summer uniform

h4. See also

* [[Yuigaoka school uniform]]

title: unofficial_precure_costume
body:
Unofficial designs for the different uniforms worn throughout the [[Precure]] franchise. Unlike with [[unofficial Sailor Senshi uniform]], which just has one base design, Precure has multiple uniform designs for its main Cures and some villain teams. This is why the tag uses the term [i]costume[/i] rather than [i]uniform[/i] so that all of the designs for each series can be covered here.

This shouldn’t include merely an alternate color or an adaptation of an existing costume. The designs for both the character and clothing should be entirely different and not canon. This is usually depicted with fan designs for characters who never become Cures wearing their own unique adaptation of an existing uniform. It is possible for an existing Cure to [[cosplay]] as another one to the point of changing their hairstyle and adding/reducing embellishments to match the character they’re cosplaying. Another possibility is a [[light persona]] or [[dark persona]] being depicted in a fan made uniform based off of an existing one.

This tag could go hand-in-hand with [[alternate universe]] if it is a full-on scene of a fanmade character design interacting with canon characters, rather than a character just standing there showing off an outfit (post #1400262).

Consider adding [[in-franchise crossover]] if the fan design for one series’ Cure(s) is directly based off of another series’ Cure(s). For instance, post #5092919 has [[Futari wa Precure]] characters wearing adapted costumes based off of [[Mahou Girls Precure!]].

title: durin_(genshin_impact)
body:
A character from [[Genshin Impact]]; a [[dragon]].

He is often depicted in canon as a black skeletal dragon with glowing [[red eyes]].

His origins are: [spoiler]He was created by [[Rhinedottir (genshin_impact)|]].[/spoiler]

In Genshin lore, [spoiler]Durin was killed in battle by [[dvalin (genshin impact)|Dvalin]], and Durin's remains landed in Dragonspine. Its corpse still has influence on the residents of Dragonspine in the present day.[/spoiler]

Not to be confused with [[Mini_Durin_(genshin_impact)|Mini Durin]], who appears as a [[small dragon]], and who is really <spoiler>an alternate counterpart created by the Hexenzirkel.</spoiler>

title: yashiro_nene
body:
One of the protagonists from [[Jibaku Shounen Hanako-kun]], alongside [[Hanako (jibaku_shounen_hanako-kun)|]] and [[Minamoto Kou|Kou]].

Due to a curse enacted upon her during the start of the series, any contact with water [spoiler] turns her into a [[yashiro_nene_(fish)|fish]][/spoiler].

* !post #5988341: Official art

Yashiro is known to be earnest and outgoing; her kindness, however, can border into naiveté. This sometimes leaves her vulnerable to exploitation.

Her Japanese VA is [[Kitou Akari]].

title: baraduke
body:
[b]Baraduke[/b] (バラデューク [i]Baradyūku[/i]), also known as [b]Alien Sector[/b] in the western world, is a 2D scrolling [[science fiction]] shooter arcade [[video game]] that was released by [[Namco]] in 1985. It runs on Namco Pac-Land hardware but with a video system like that used in Metro-Cross and Dragon Buster. 

The game is notable because [[Toby Masuyo]], one of its main protagonists, predates by one year [[Samus Aran]] from [[Metroid]] as a human female playable character.

h4. See also

* [[Paccet]]

title: sixteenth_rest
body:
A [[musical note|musical symbol]] denoting a rest (pause) that lasts for 1/16th of a whole note, or the length of a [[sixteenth note]]. It looks like the [[eighth rest]] but has two 'flags' attached instead of one.

* !asset #20779043

h4. See also

* [[sixteenth note]]
* [[beamed sixteenth notes]]
* [[dotted sixteenth note]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Sixteenth note (rest)":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sixteenth_note
* "Wikipedia: Rest (music)":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rest_(music)

title: eighth_rest
body:
A [[musical note|musical symbol]] denoting a rest (pause) that lasts for 1/8th of a whole note, or the length of an [[eighth note]]. The eighth rest appears as a vertical line with a circular-like 'flag' drawn on the left side.

* !asset #20779045

h4. See also

* [[eighth note]]
* [[beamed eighth notes]]
* [[dotted eighth note]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Eighth note (rest)":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eighth_note
* "Wikipedia: Rest (music)":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rest_(music)

title: sixteenth_note
body:
A [[musical note]] representing a 16th note (1/16 of a [[whole note]]). These are notated with an oval, filled-in note head and a straight note stem with two flags.

h4. Examples

* !asset #20723855

h4. See also

* [[beamed sixteenth notes]]
* [[dotted sixteenth note]]
* [[sixteenth rest]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Sixteenth note":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sixteenth_note
* "Wikipedia: Musical note":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Musical_note

title: quarter_note
body:
A [[musical note]] representing a quarter note (1/4 of a [[whole note]]). Visually, it appears like ♩ (a filled-in oval with a note stem (vertical line) that can be drawn upward or downward).

h4. Examples

* !asset #20723853

h4. See also

* [[dotted quarter note]]
* [[quarter rest]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Quarter note":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quarter_note
* "Wikipedia: Musical note":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Musical_note

title: quarter_rest
body:
A [[musical note|musical symbol]] representing the quarter rest (pause), or a length of silence equal to one quarter of a whole note. A visual example is the squiggly symbol resembling a lightning in post #3942900. An archaic version of the note can be seen in post #3942893

* !asset #20779046

h4. See also

* [[quarter note]]
* [[dotted quarter note]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Quarter note (rest)":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quarter_note
* "Wikipedia: Rest (music)":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rest_(music)

title: half_note
body:
A [[musical note]] representing a half note (1/2 of a [[whole note]]). Visually, it's a hollow oval note head (like what the [[whole note]] uses) with a note stem (vertical line) drawn either upward or downward.

h4. Examples

* !asset #20723852

h4. See also

* [[dotted half note]]
* [[half rest]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Half note":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Half_note
* "Wikipedia: Musical note":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Musical_note

title: whole_note
body:
A [[musical note]] representing a whole note (2 half notes). Visually, it appears similar to the hollow oval that the [[half note]] uses, but has no note stem (vertical line).

h4. Examples

* !asset #20723859

h4. See also

* [[whole rest]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Whole note":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Whole_note
* "Wikipedia: Musical note":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Musical_note

title: beamed_sixteenth_notes
body:
One of the more iconic symbols of [[musical note|musical notation]], along with the [[treble clef]] and the [[eighth note]]. The "beamed" part of its name refers to the pair of stripes connecting the tops of the stems of the two notes that connect it to another. 

A pair of beamed sixteenth notes looks like this: ♬ 
For those without Unicode support, "click here.":http://www.charbase.com/images/glyph/9836

h4.See also

* [[sixteenth note]]
* [[sixteenth rest]]
* [[dotted sixteenth note]]

title: c-3po
body:
A fictional [[humanoid robot]] from the [[Star Wars]] franchise.

The [b]C-3P0[/b] protocol [[robot|droid]] appears in the first Star War film from 1977. Since then he has been played by English actor "Anthony Daniels":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anthony_Daniels on each and every Star Wars movie and other related media.

The character was designed by "Ralph McQuarrie":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ralph_McQuarrie in the 70s. According to him, C-3PO was based in the [[Maschinenmensch]] android from the 1927 silent sci-fi film [[Metropolis (Fritz Lang)]].

h4.See also

* [[R2-D2]]

title: humanoid_robot
body:
A [[robot]] that has a humanoid shape (bipedal with distinct arms and legs), but cannot pass for a human like an [[android]]. The robot should be clearly distinguishable from a human, and should not have a human-like face.

Note that while most [[mecha]] are humanoid, they should not be tagged under this tag. Instead, use the appropriate subtag of [[non-humanoid robot]] for the more uncommon cases of non-humanoid mecha.

h4. Examples

* !post #5811776
* !post #5108702
* !post #6258325
* !post #7929117

h4. Notable characters

* [[C-3PO]], [[B1 Battle Droid]] ([[Star Wars]])
* [[Canti]] ([[FLCL]])
* [[MRVN]], [[Phase Shift Pilot (titanfall 2)|]], [[Stim Pilot (titanfall 2)|]] ([[Titanfall (series)|]])
* [[Pathfinder (apex legends)|]], [[Revenant (apex legends)|]] ([[Apex Legends]])
* [[Chappie (robot)|]] ([[Chappie]])
* [[Nise Maou Kikaizeru]] ([[Yuusha to Maou]])
* [[Atlas (boston dynamics)|]] ([[Boston Dynamics]])
* [[ASIMO]] ([[Honda]])
* [[Zenyatta (overwatch)|]] ([[Overwatch]])
* [[Metabee]] ([[Medarot]])
* [[Bender Bending Rodriguez]] ([[Futurama]])

H4. External links

* "Wikipedia - Humanoid robot":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Humanoid_robot]

title: mechabare
body:
Exposed mechanical, robotic, or cybernetic body parts, systems, innards, etc of a [[cyborg]], [[android]], or other robotic character.

Use this tag for:

* Exposed parts or inner workings of a [[cyborg]], [[android]], or robotic character.
* Diagrams, schematics, x-ray views, or other inner views of a robotic character's parts or inner workings.
* [[Damaged]], missing, or obviously artificial limbs or body parts.
* [[Cyborg]], [[android]], or robotic characters that are unmistakably inhuman because of their exposed mechanical parts.

Do not use this tag for:

* Actual [[mecha]] and non-humanoid [[robot]]s.
* Simple robot seam lines, [[robot joints]] or [[doll joints]].
* Conventional [[machine]]s, devices, appliances, or parts.

h4. Examples

* !post #5950200
* !post #6300500

h4. See also

title: yingxing_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A past form of [[Blade (Honkai: Star Rail)|]] from [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. 

Yingxing and Blade's current form generally look rather similar, down to wearing the same outfit. The most notable differences are:
* Yingxing's hair is [[grey hair|grey]] and [[folded ponytail|folded]] into a [[ponytail]] with a [[hair stick]], while modern-era Blade has [[dark blue hair|dark blue]] loose hair,
* Yingxing generally does not wear any [[bandage]]s,
* Yingxing's eyes are light blue-ish [[purple eyes|purple]], while Blade's current form's are [[red eyes|red]]-to-[[orange eyes|orange]] instead. However, this detail might end up being skipped, especially in older fanworks, as more accurate references of his eye color were not supplied until later.

title: ulu_(reverse:1999)
body:
[b]Ulu[/b]  is a playable character from [[Reverse:1999]]. She is one of the supporting cast of the "Revival! The Uluru Games." sidestory. An arcanist that made of fire, she is the best friend of the previous Priestess of the Uluru Games. After Priestess's reincarnation to [[Spathodea (Reverse:1999)|Spathodea]], she quickly become her best friend too. She shows Spathodea the way to Uluru Stadium, and helped in her problems on the way to revive the game, and with her new friend [[Ezra Theodore|Ezra]].

She is voiced by Isabella Sprovieri in English and [[Sasahara Yuu]] in Japanese.

Komukai-san is a minefield (?) of a girl, a delinquent who keeps trying to convince Kuraishi to skip school! She'll miss classes, skip cram school, and ignore her parents. title: pachikar
body:
A minor NPC in [[Toushin Toshi II]], and a boss character in its remake, [[Toushin Toshi Girls Gift]].

In the original game, Pachikar is a pessimistic, low-ranking [[angel]] who spends her time at a desk stamping documents, lamenting that she never does anything fun in her life. In Girl's Gift, however, her character is completely overhauled, as she is now a hot-blooded Angel Knight with a strong will, known by the epithet "Fist Angel" due to using a pair of red [[boxing gloves]] for weapons.

Her design in the original game featured Pachikar with [[short hair|short]], [[orange hair]] and [[orange eyes]], wearing a [[white dress]]. In Girls Gift, Pachikar's design is altered to give her [[long hair|long]], [[blonde hair]], and she now wears a blue and white [[halterneck]] with large, golden [[wristband]]s adorned with the [[venus symbol|Venus]] and [[Mars symbol|Mars]] symbols. She also wears a [[white skirt]].

title: morikubo_nono
body:
An [[idol]] in the [[idolmaster cinderella girls|THE IDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]] series. As a cowardly girl with no self-esteem, she remains an idol only because she lacks the will to quit. Even so, she often disappears from work to hide in quiet, dark places, like [[under_table|underneath]] the [[producer_(idolmaster)|Producer's]] desk. She considers these places her "Sanctuary". 

In most illustrations, Nono is shown avoiding eye contact with the viewer by [[looking away]] to one side. This was also adapted into [[idolmaster cinderella girls starlight stage|Starlight Stage]], where her model has the unique trait of avoiding direct eye contact with the camera (with the exception to this being when she is wearing one of the special costumes provided by her SS Rare cards). This trait is even referenced in her own name, which when written in hiragana (のの) resemble a pair of eyes looking to the side.

After ranking 4th in the "5th Cinderella Girl General Election":[https://www.project-imas.wiki/THE_iDOLM@STER_Cinderella_Girls_General_Election#5th_Cinderella_Girl_General_Election] on May 13th, 2016, she was one four girls selected to receive a voice. Her voice debuted on the web radio program [i]Shiny Numbers[/i] ("video":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4czi911GBBM]), where her voice actor was revealed to be [[Takahashi Karin]].

title: help:pools
body:
Pools are ordered collection of related images. Unlike [[help:tags|tags]] or [[help:post relationships|parent/child relationships]], the posts in a pool have a specific order.

Pools are typically for series of related images, such as [[comic]]s or sets of related images by an artist. These pools are called [b]series[/b] pools and have purple-colored names.

Another use of pools is for collections of posts that share a common, subjective theme. These pools are called [b]collection[/b] pools and have blue-colored names. Some of these pools are organized under the [[pool groups]] page.

h4. Rules

* Don't create pools for personal collections of your favorite posts. Use [[help:favorite groups|favorite groups]] for that. Personal pools will be subject to deletion in topic #8282.
* Avoid creating collection pools when a tag would do.

h4. Howto

h6. Name a pool

Series pool names should generally follow the format "Copyright - Title (Artist)". 

* If the pool spans multiple series, you can use "Various" as the copyright.
* If the pool contains images by multiple artists, you can use "various artists".
* If the pool has an unknown artist (e.g., for official art pools), you can omit the artist part.
* If the pool title is not English, you can either translate it or use the original language title. Unicode characters are supported in pool names. 
* If the artist has not given a title to the series, try to pick something relevant to the series.
* If the pool is a sample of a series, add [sample] after the title.

h6. Create a pool

Go to the "Pools":/pools page in the top menu, then click on "New":/pools/new in the top submenu. Type the name of the pool, set its category, and write a description of it. Click submit to create the pool.

Alternatively, you can tag a post with [code]newpool:name[/code], where [code]name[/code] is the name of the new pool.

h6. Add posts to a pool

Click on [b]Add to pool[/b] from the post's page. A window will pop up where you can search for the pool you want by typing part of its name.

Alternatively, you can tag a post with [code]pool:<name>[/code] to add it to a pool. For example, to add a post to the "Disgustingly Adorable":/pools/903 pool, you could tag the post with {{pool:Disgustingly_Adorable}} or {{pool:903}}.

Lastly, you can go to the pool's [b]Edit[/b] page, then add the post's ID in the [b]Posts[/b] field.

h6. Remove posts from a pool

Go to the pool's [b]Edit[/b] page, search for the post's ID in the [b]Posts[/b] field, and remove the ID from the list.

Alternatively, you can tag a post with [code]-pool:<name>[/code] to remove it from a pool. For example, to remove a post from the "Disgustingly Adorable":/pools/3550 pool, you could tag the post with {{-pool:Disgustingly_Adorable}} or {{-pool:903}}.

h6. Modify a pool's order

Click the [b]Order[/b] link at the top of the page while viewing the pool. You can then drag and drop the posts into the correct order.

For pools with over 1000 posts, the [b]Order[/b] link will not appear. To order these large pools, you should instead go to the pool's [b]Edit[/b] page, search for the IDs of the posts you want to reorder in the [b]Posts[/b] field, and reorder them within that text field.

h6. Rename a pool

Go to the pool's [b]Edit[/b] page, change the [b]Name[/b] field, then click save.

h6. Delete a pool

Go to the pool's [b]Edit[/b] page, then click the [b]Delete[/b] link in the top menu, then click the confirm button. To undelete a pool, click the [b]Undelete[/b] button. Pools can be safely deleted and undeleted with no loss of information.

Deleting and undeleting pools may only be performed by Builder-level users and above.

h4. See also

* [[Pool Groups]]
* [[Help:Post Relationships]]
* Topic #8282 (Pointless Pools)

title: respirator
body:
A half-face [[mask]] that covers the nose and mouth and uses a filter to protect the wearer from inhaling harmful dust, fumes, vapors, or gases.

If the mask covers the eyes, then it's a [[gas mask]], not a respirator.

h4. Examples

* !post #7400500
* !post #1146908

h4. See also

* [[gas mask]]
* [[oxygen mask]]

title: gas_mask
body:
A full-face [[mask]] that protects the wearer from toxic gases and airborne pollutants by covering their nose, mouth, and eyes. 

They protect the wearer by forming a sealed cover over the nose and mouth and filters the air that they breath in to prevent inhaling toxic gases or pollutants. The mask also protects the eyes from exposure to toxic gases or pollutants that may cause irritation, temporary blindness, or even permanent eye damage. 

If the mask doesn't cover the eyes, then it's a [[respirator]], not a [[gas mask]].

h4. Examples

* !asset #22763215
* !post #5156782

h4. See also

* [[respirator]]
* [[oxygen mask]]

For face masks used for skincare, see [[beauty mask]].

title: surgical_mask
body:
A [[mouth mask]] of the type worn by [[doctor]]s and [[nurse]]s to prevent the spread of bacteria from the wearer's mouth and nose.  It is composed of a rectangular piece of cloth with several horizontal folds to allow it to stretch over the mouth and nose.

This term refers to two similar types of medical masks, a [i]procedure mask[/i] and [i]surgical mask[/i]. Procedure masks may not be sterile and fasten by looping around the ears; used when carrying out general medical procedures like a check-up. Surgical masks are sterile and are fastened by bands that loop around the head; used when carrying out surgeries.

In Japan, it is common to wear a face mask whilst ill to avoid infecting others in public settings. During the [[coronavirus pandemic]], it became common to wear masks worldwide.

They are also worn by delinquents, from school renegades to [[bousouzoku]] and the [[yakuza]]. 

h4. Examples

* !post #4047059

h4. See also

* [[Fellatio under mask]]
* [[Mask around one ear]]

title: destroyer
body:
A [b]Destroyer[/b] is a type of medium-sized (smaller than most cruisers including lights but larger than a corvette or frigate)  [[warship]] designed for interception, torpedo attack, long-range patrol, and defense of larger capital ships including Battleships and Carriers.

Although originally designed for the distinct purpose of hunting torpedo boats, destroyers have become for the past 80 years, the most common large warships still operated by bluewater navies today.

title: borrowed_character
body:
When an artist draws an [[original]] character which was originally created by a different artist.

If an artist draws his own original character(s) with the borrowed character(s), or draws borrowed character(s) from more than one artist, also tag [[crossover]].

This also cover works where artist draws a stolen original character from another artist, where artist copied the design of other artist's OC and labelled as their own. In this case, tag that said original character with the name given by the original artist.

Note that "描いてもいいのよ":http://dic.pixiv.net/a/描いてもいいのよ is not supposed to indicate a borrowed character. It is supposed to be used to indicate the original artist is fine with others drawing their character. 

h4. See also

* [[borrowed design]]
* pool #1338 (Popular Artists Draw Other Copyrights)
other_names: 描かせていただきました

title: mysterious_heroine_xx_(fate)
body:
Foreigner-class version of [[Mysterious Heroine X (fate)|]]. She has three distinct designs depending on her Ascension level:

* [[mysterious_heroine_xx_(first_ascension)_(fate)|First Ascension]] is her as a [[mecha musume]] wearing [[full armor]].
* [[mysterious heroine xx (second ascension) (fate)|Second Ascension]] loses some of the armor to show her face, and she wears a large [[blue scarf]], [[skin tight]] clothes under her armor, and metal gloves and boots.
* Third Ascension loses the armor completely, and she wears a blue [[baseball cap]], a [[white bikini]], [[strappy heels]], and a blue [[shrug (clothing)|shrug]].

Mysterious Heroine XX wields [[Twinmyniad (fate)|]], a double-bladed version of [[Rhongomyniad (fate)|]]. Her breasts get [[medium breasts|slightly]] [[large breasts|larger]] with each Ascension, though never as big as [[Artoria Pendragon (lancer) (fate)|]].

Personality-wise, she's an older, more mature version of Heroine X (and also fills the role of being a swimsuit version of her).  She's nowhere near as obsessed as X is with eliminating all the other Sabers, to the point that she sometimes forgets about it completely, and is more focused on eliminating Foreigners. In-universe, she's a Galactic Police officer, but more or less abandons her post to go to Chaldea after the events of the 2018 summer event (2020 for North America).

While her First and Second Ascensions are given character tags, her Third Ascension bikini and shrug is considered her 'default' costume and thus has not been given a tag.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #22759417: Third Ascension
* !asset #22759418: [[mysterious heroine xx (second ascension) (fate)|Second Ascension]]

title: impossible_clothes
body:
Clothing that is unrealistically [[skin tight]], especially between and beneath the [[breasts]]. Normal clothing does not hug the [[breasts]] on all sides. Impossible clothing hugs the body in ways that normal clothing could never do.

Although this is most commonly seen with [[breasts]], it may also occur with other body parts (post #352925).

See [[tight clothes]] or [[skin tight]] for clothing that is very tight, but not unrealistically so.

The Japanese term is 乳袋 ([i]chichi-bukuro[/i], lit. "breasts sack").

title: tteoguji
body: Traditional Korean headdress worn during the [[Joseon Dynasty]]. Worn by queens and crown princesses for formal attire. It resembles two large hair rings, of which flop over the scalp diagonally. It is one of many styles of carved-wood wig ornaments in Korea, called gache (加髢). It was usually made from paulownia, a lightweight wood, and engraved with braid patterns. h5. External Links "Google Arts and Culture: Tteo-guji, Wooden Wig":[https://artsandculture.google.com/asset/tteo-guji-wooden-wig-unkown/JwGC9ZnHIoBmkw?hl=en]

title: jacques_schnee
body:
A major antagonist of [[rwby|RWBY]]. CEO of the Schnee Dust Company, along with being the husband of [[Willow Schnee|]] and the father of [[Weiss Schnee|]], [[Winter Schnee|]] and [[Whitley Schnee|]]. A callous and manipulative businessman, his amoral actions have given the company a bad reputation and driven his wife into alcoholism. He is the arch-enemy to Weiss, who actively works to restore the previous and better reputation of the company.

[spoilers]In Volume 7, Jacques wins the election for councilman after rigging the votes, with help from [[Arthur Watts|]]. However, his treachery is found and revealed by his own daughter and Jacques is arrested for his crimes. During the conclusion of Volume 8, he is murdered by [[James Ironwood]].[/spoilers]

title: cinder_fall
body:
A major antagonist in the Rooster Teeth series [[RWBY]].

h4. Abilities
Cinder can produce and control fire. She also wields a variety of weapons including [[sword]]s, a [[bow]] and a [[spear]].

h4. Physical characteristics
Cinder is 5'11" tall including high heels. She has [[black hair]] and [[yellow_eyes|amber eyes]]. [spoiler]After suffering major injury at the end of Volume 3, she is thereafter missing an [[missing_limb|arm]] and an [[one-eyed|eye]] and has a large [[scar_on_face|scar]] on the left side of her face. [/spoiler]

h4. Attire
Cinder's outfit varies from volume to volume, but is usually red and black with gold decorations.

h4. External links
* "RWBY Wikia: Cinder Fall":https://rwby.fandom.com/wiki/Cinder_Fall

title: nora_valkyrie
body:
Nora Valkyrie is a supporting character in [[RWBY]], a 3DCG series produced by Rooster Teeth.

Nora is a member of Team JNPR, and is the "N" in the team's name. She is highly energetic and has a bouncy, cheerful personality. Her design and abilities are inspired by Thor.

h4. Abilities 

Nora wields [[Magnhild]], a weapon that can transform between a large two-handed hammer and a revolver-action grenade launcher. Her symbol is a hammer with a lightning bolt through it. Her semblance (special ability) allows her to absorb electrical energy and convert it to a temporary strength boost.

h4. Physical characteristics

Nora is short (5' 1") and curvy, and has [[short hair|short]] [[orange hair]] and greenish eyes.

[spoiler]As of volume 8 episode 3, her arms and upper body are covered in [[Lichtenberg figure]]-shaped scars.[/spoiler]

h4. Attire

Nora usually wears pink and white clothing accented with black and/or blue. In addition to her hammer and lightning symbol, her outfits often incorporate one or more heart-shaped designs. Most of her outfits include a short skirt.

h4. External links

https://rwby.fandom.com/wiki/Nora_Valkyrie

title: felicia_(darkstalkers)
body:
[[Cat girl]] character from the [[Darkstalkers]] fighting game series.

Felicia was raised by a Catholic nun named Rose. When Rose died, Felicia left her town hoping to be a musical star. During her travels, she met many other catgirls of her kind. With her newfound friends, she set out for her dream of being on stage. Eventually, she and her friends started a musical with Felicia being the main star. She has [[big hair|voluminous]] [[blue hair]], [[white fur]], [[cat ears]], and a [[cat tail]].

h4. External links

* "Capcom Database: Felicia":http://capcom.wikia.com/wiki/Felicia

title: cross_edge
body:
A role-playing video game for the PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360. The game was developed in collaboration by Capcom, Nippon Ichi, Namco Bandai, Gust, and Idea Factory.

The game features characters from [[Darkstalkers]] (Vampire in Japan), [[Disgaea]], [[Ar tonelico]], [[Spectral Souls]]: Resurrection of the Ethereal Empires, [[Atelier Marie]] and [[Mana Khemia 2]]: Fall of Alchemy.

h4.Official artists

* [[Hirano Katsuyuki]] (Cross Edge characters, Ar Tonelico, Atelier Marie, Disgaea, Mana Khemia 2, Spectral Souls)
* [[Nakamura Tatsunori]] (Cross Edge characters, Vampire)
* [[Tsunako]] (Cross Edge characters)

title: q-bee
body:
A character from the [[Darkstalkers]] series.

Leader of the Soul Bees and Character in Capcom's Vampire/Darkstalker series.

She premiered in [b]Vampire Savior/Darkstalkers 3[/b], and is noted for her Homing Airdash being a very powerful tool. Uses a variety of moves highlighting her bee nature, including ES C->R, which Coccoons the enemy and a daughter hatches from it, +B, a move where she covers the foes in bees, and QJ, which coats the foe in a bubble of honey, preventing movement.

[b]Soul Bees[/b] are very simillar to Earth bees as far as Sex Roles and Society. The [[compound eyes]] and [[Antennae]] are the primary sensory organs. [b]Soul Bees[/b] take on a humanlike form and can mate with most creatures, as well as lure prey. A [b]Soul Bee[/b]'s intellect is comperable to a human 5 year old, and are driven heavily on instinct. Soul Bees are carnivorous and can eat niegh anything, dying if no food is consumed in 48 hours.

In story, the [b]Soul Bees[/b] inhabit the Doma lands of Makai, which has become barren over the years. When [[Jedah Dohma]] returns from death, they align with him to collect souls in exchange for being able to eat freely. In [[Q-Bee]]'s ending, she betrays [[Jedah Dohma]] to her instincts to eat, and the [b]Soul Bee[/b] population explodes, threatening overpopulation causing extinction.

[[Q-Bee]] also appears as Cards in the SVC: Card Fighters' Clash series, an enemy unit in NamcoXCapcom, and various [[Darkstalkers]] Adaptations in roles of various significance.

Not to be confused with the [[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica]] character [[Kyubey]].

She is voiced by [i]Matsushita Miyuki[/i], but the only sounds the character makes are buzzes.

h4. See also

* "Wikipedia":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Q-Bee

title: svc_chaos
body:
Otherwise known as [b]SNK vs. Capcom: SVC Chaos[/b] or [b]SVC Chaos: SNK vs. Capcom[/b], this game is a crossover between SNK's [[The King of Fighters]], [[Ryuuko no Ken]] (Art of Fighting), [[Fatal Fury]], [[Samurai Spirits]] (Samurai Shodown), [[Athena (series)|]] and [[Metal Slug]] with Capcom's [[Street Fighter]], [[Warzard]] (Red Earth), [[Darkstalkers]] (Vampire), [[Mega Man (series)|]], and [[Makaimura]] (Ghosts'n Goblins'). The SNK-produced portion of the [i][[Capcom vs SNK|Capcom vs. SNK]][/i] series.

When a player gets hit by one of [[Demitri Maximoff]]'s supers, he will briefly enter a state called "[[Midnight Bliss]]". When the player is defeated by [[Princess Athena]], he will become an animal. On the other hand, when the player is defeated by [[Red Arremer]], he will become a demon.

h4.External links
* "SNK Wiki: SNK vs. Capcom: SVC Chaos":https://snk.fandom.com/wiki/SNK_vs._Capcom:_SVC_Chaos

title: jedah_dohma
body:
[b]Jedah Dohma (ジェダ・ドーマ)[/b] is a [[Darkstalkers]] character who first debuted in [b]Vampire Savior: The Lord of Vampire (a.k.a. Darkstalkers 3)[/b].

He is a Demon from Makai and is over 6000 years old, he is the youngest out of the three High nobles of Makai. He was always concerned about the future of Makai. He believed that if Makai was left to rule by Belial, the master of the Aensland family and the true ruler of Makai, then it would fall into chaos. Belial would most likely say that is destiny and life. To Jedah, Belial was a being who is not fit to rule. He looked for an opportunity to destroy Belial and waited for the right time to strike as a means to control the realm for himself. 

After a century long sleep, Jedah was revived in Makai. He felt concern towards the realm Makai, with nobles fighting each other. Instead of anger, he felt pity towards Ozomu. Jedah had already made up his mind: his complete revival and the cleansing of all souls. For this, a new stage was necessary. A new realm, the Majigen.

title: kimoto_takenori
body:
Takenori Kimoto is a charater and effect designer involved with [[Capcom]] since Super [[Street Fighter II (series)|]] Turbo, for which he served as a planner. He is, however, more notable for his work on the [[Darkstalkers]] series, where he designed [[Anakaris]]. Other work includes One Piece Mansion, Apollo Justice: Ace Attorney and the cancelled Mega Man Universe.

He is mainly known by his alias, Kimo Kimo.

title: puzzle_fighter
body: A one or two player tile-matching puzzle video game first released in the spring of 1996 by [[Capcom]] on the CPS II arcade system, otherwise known as [b]Super Puzzle Fighter II: Turbo[/b] ([b]Super Puzzle Fighter II: X[/b] in Japan). The game's title is a [[parody]] of [[Street Fighter II (series)|Street Fighter II Turbo]] (or Super Street Fighter II X in Japan), with music and interface elements spoofing the [[Street Fighter Zero (series)|Street Fighter Zero]] and [[Darkstalkers]] games.

title: name_connection
body:
A joke, reference, or pairing based on two characters or things having the same or similar names. For example, a [[cosplay]] or [[crossover]] between two characters from different franchises having the same name.

Don't use for characters who share the same name because they're relatives, or for [[dual persona]] or alternate versions of the same character appearing in different titles. For namesakes based on animals or inanimate objects, use [[object namesake]] too.

h4. Examples

* !post #358133: Five Sakuras ([[shinguuji_sakura|Shinguuji]], [[kasugano_sakura|Kasugano]], [[matou_sakura|Matou]], [[haruno_sakura|Haruno]], and [[kinomoto_sakura|Kinomoto]])

title: chainsaw_man
body:
A Japanese manga series written and illustrated by [[Fujimoto Tatsuki]] that ran in [[Shounen Jump]] from January 2019 to January 2021 and has a sequel that began serialization on July 13, 2022  for Jump+. There is a Fall 2022 anime adaptation by MAPPA.

Set in a world where humans coexists with devils, who are born from humanity's fear. The series focus on [[Denji (Chainsaw Man)|]], an impoverished man who formed a contract with the devil [[Pochita (Chainsaw Man)|]], transformed him into the [[Chainsaw Devil]] i.e the titular "Chainsaw Man".

title: fake_blood
body:
A substance that appears to be [[blood]], but isn't - in color artworks, commonly [[ketchup]], [[red bean paste]], [[jam]] or [[paint]]; though monochrome ones might also use other substances, like [[chocolate]].

Not every instance of a red fluid is necessarily faux blood - look for crazed expressions, knives, signs of "injuries", or people [[playing dead|lying lifelessly]] on the floor (with the source of "blood" visible).

h4. See also
* [[Ambiguous red liquid]] - when it cannot be determined if the liquid is blood or not

title: playing_dead
body:
When someone pretends to be [[death|dead]].

If used as a [[prank]], may be accompanied by [[fake blood]], knives, or signs of "injury".

title: iyagatteru_kimi_ga_suki
body:
Ongoing webcomic based on [[oniyama831|Oniyama Mizuki]]'s [i][[Sonna Futari wa Tsukiatteiru]][/i] series of comics.
Roughly translated title: [i]To The Hateful You, I Like You.[/i]

Ootsuki Makoto confesses his feelings to Shirakawa Mikoto, and the two begin dating.

[spoiler]A story of mutual exploitation with multiple victims. Iyagatteru Kimi Ga Suki explores various fringe paraphilias and the psychology of the characters in detail as their most depraved feelings are exposed(while keeping things classy).[/spoiler]

[spoiler]Its prevailing spirit is an exploration of[i] a perversion of romantic emotions,[/i] rather than crass fringe sexual perversion for perversion's sake.[/spoiler]


80s styled [spoiler]arguably horror[/spoiler] romance written in the modern era [spoiler]with grotesque (guro) elements.[/spoiler]

Absolutely not your conventional [i]shoujo[/i] love story. Filled with dark and ironic humor.

[spoiler][i]How deep does the rabbit hole go?[/i][/spoiler]
other_names: 嫌がってるキミが好き
喜欢的就是一脸嫌恶的你

title: capcom_fighting_jam

Capcom Fighting Jam, released in North America as Capcom Fighting Evolution, is a 2004 [[crossover]] fighting game from [[Capcom]]. It features characters from the [[Street Fighter]], [[Darkstalkers]] and [[Warzard]] series.

title: midnight_bliss
body:
The [b]Midnight Bliss[/b] ([b]ミッドナイトブリス[/b]) is a special move used by [[Demitri Maximoff]] from the [[darkstalkers|Vampire/Darkstalkers]] seires.

Demitri glides forward, tosses a rose at the opponent, transforms them into a hapless maiden ([b]including male characters![/b]), bows before them, holds them in the air, and then drains the life energy out of the opponent.

The move was very popular in the original game, but became even more popular when Demitri was put in [[SVC Chaos]] which forced the development team to make [[genderswap|genderswapped]] sprites for the male characters both from [[SNK]] and [[Capcom]]. A few years later Demitri was included in the roster for [[Capcom Fighting Jam]] which should be no surprise as to what happens next after that.

The move's name is also used a common tag on [[pixiv]] for genderswapping male characters that have or come from an official fighting game, or for drawing female characters as they are depicted from the original fighting games when under the effect of the Midnight Bliss.

h4. Midnight Bliss compilation videos

* [[darkstalkers|Vampire/Darkstalkers]]: YouTube "Video 1":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aOPNAB4C_uQ (Video was made private!)
* Darkstalkers Revenge: YouTube "Video 1":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eJls2jI6WHA
* Darkstalkers Resurrection: YouTube "Video 1":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ux_TzeaEAPk
* [[SVC Chaos]]: YouTube "Video 1":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iEZCqQLWznk and "Video 2":http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sJtIk9z7TN0

title: tatsunoko_vs_capcom
body:
One of Capcom's additions to the "Vs." crossover fighting game series. It pits the anime characters of [[tatsunoko pro|Tatsunoko Production]] against the video game characters of [[Capcom]].

Originally released only in Japan under the caption of [b][i]Cross Generation of Heroes[/i][/b], fan reception led Capcom to localize an updated version of the game internationally under the caption of [b][i]Ultimate All-Stars[/i][/b].

title: len'en
body:
Len'en (鏈縁 or 連縁, lit. "Connecting Chain") is a series of vertical [[danmaku]] shooting games made by [[jynx (trick nostalgie)|JynX]], set in the land of Mugenri. Although inspired by [[Touhou]] and [[Seihou]], the games are not Touhou fangames. They are set in a separate world featuring an entirely new cast of characters.

Also of note is that while in Touhou the characters are all female, in Len'en [[androgynous|the characters' genders are generally left ambiguous.]] It is likely that their genders will never be revealed, and that it will simply be up to the player's interpretation. Most of the characters have names that reference birds.

h4. Games

* 鏈縁 无現里 (Len'en Mugenri) ～ [[Evanescent Existence]] 
* 鏈縁 蛇叢釼 (Len'en Tasouken) ～ [[Earthen Miraculous Sword]] 
* 鏈縁霊烈傳 (Len'en Reiretsuden) ～ [[Reactivate Majestical Imperial]] 
* 連縁天影戦記 (Len'en Teneisenki) ～ [[Brilliant Pagoda or Haze Castle]]
* 連縁カフェ (Len'en Cafe) ～ [[BOOK of the CAFE]]

title: vinyl_scratch
body:
An extra character from [[My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic]].

A white unicorn with bright blue hair and sunglasses also known as DJ Pon3.

Most fan art of her depict her with bright [[red eyes]], but her first appearance without her glasses was in lighting that made her eyes appear [[purple eyes|purple]]. 

Fans tend to pair her with [[Octavia Melody]] because of their wildly divergent personalities and musical tastes, and they were seen living together in the background pony-oriented hundredth episode.

title: huevocartoon
body: Huevocartoon is a Mexican multimedia entertainment brand and animation studio founded in November 2001 by Gabriel and Rodolfo Riva Palacio Alatriste, Carlos Zepeda Chehaibar, and Rodolfo Riva Palacio Velasco. It consists of an internet series, six feature films, a video game, a television special, and advertisements, featuring anthropomorphic eggs in a civilized and humorous setting.

title: star_trek:_the_next_generation
body:
Star Trek: The Next Generation (TNG) is an American science fiction television series created by Gene Roddenberry. It originally aired from September 28, 1987, to May 23, 1994, in syndication, spanning 178 episodes over seven seasons. The third series in the [[Star Trek]] franchise, it was inspired by [[Star Trek: The Original Series]]. Set in the latter third of the 24th century, when Earth is part of the United Federation of Planets, it follows the adventures of a Starfleet starship, the [[USS Enterprise]] (NCC-1701-D), in its exploration of the Alpha quadrant in the Milky Way galaxy.

The Next Generation featured a new crew: [[Patrick Stewart]] as Captain [[Jean-Luc Picard]], Jonathan Frakes as [[William Riker]], Brent Spiner as Data, Michael Dorn as [[worf (star trek)|Worf]], LeVar Burton as [[Geordi La Forge]], Marina Sirtis as [[Deanna Troi]], Gates McFadden as Dr. [[Beverly Crusher]], Denise Crosby as Tasha Yar, Wil Wheaton as Wesley Crusher, and a new Enterprise.

Source: Wikipedia.

title: sturmabteilung
body:
[i]Sturmabteilung[/i] (German for "Storm Division") was the original paramilitary wing of the [[Nazi|Nazi Party]] that played a significant role in [[Adolf Hitler]]'s rise to power in 1920s and 1930s. Its members were largely purged and their leader [[ernst julius roehm|Ernst Röhm]], was executed during the Night of the Long Knives, superseded by the [[Waffen-SS|Schutzstaffel]] despite SA continued to exist until 1945.

The SA were colloquially called Brownshirts ([i]Braunhemden[/i]) due to the color of their uniform's shirts.

h4. Uniform and insignia
Their standard [[uniform]] consisted of a [[kepi]], [[brown shirt|brown]] [[collared shirt]] paired with a [[brown necktie]], [[brown jacket|brown]] [[military jacket]], [[Sam Browne belt]], [[brown pants]] or [[jodhpurs]], and a pair of [[boots]].
The SA [[insignia]] consisted of a [[badge]] ([[Nazi party pin]]), [[collar tabs]], [[shoulder boards]], [[cuff title]], and the [[Iron Cross]]. The [[red armband|red]] party [[armband]] were often donned as well.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Sturmabteilung":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sturmabteilung

title: swastika
body:
Ancient religious symbol or [[mandala]] used in numerous cultures throughout history ([[India]], etc.). Takes the form of a [[cross]] with four legs bent at 90 degrees.

The clockwise, or right-handed, swastika (卐) was appropriated by the [[nazi|Nazi Party]] as its emblem. This variant was turned 45 degrees in a white circle on a red background which is known as Hakenkreuz (hooked cross). The symbol continues to be widely associated with Nazism to the present day. 

Another user of the clockwise swastika was the [[finland|Finnish]] Air Force, which used a blue swastika for its aircraft insignia from 1918-1944. The [[latvia|Latvian]] Air Force used a dark red version.

The counterclockwise, or left-handed, swastika (卍) is an auspicious symbol in [[Buddhism]] known in Japan as [i]manji[/i].

h4.See also
* [[Black Sun (symbol)]]
* [[Kolovrat (symbol)|]]
* [[SS insignia]]
* [[Wolfsangel]]
* [[Tag Group:Symbols]]
h4. External links
* Wikipedia: "Swastika":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Swastika]

title: russian_liberation_army
body:
The [b]Russian Liberation Army[/b] (German: [i]Russische Befreiungsarmee[/i]; Russian: Русская освободительная армия, abbreviated as РОА) was a pro-Axis [[military]] formation, primarily composed of [[Russia]]ns, that fought under German command during [[World War II]]. Active from 1942 until 1945, the [[soldier|army]] was led by a defected Soviet Army general, Andrey Vlasov.

The personnel were distinguishable by the [[shoulder patch]]es bearing the blue saltire on white background design of the [[St. Andrew's Flag]] (Russian Naval Jack), [[ushanka]]s, [[cockade]]s on [[military hat]]s that bear the white-blue-red [[russian flag|Russian tricolor]] or sometimes such stripes that were painted on their [[Stahlhelm]]e.

h4. See also
